page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable daylight plane protrusions summary

Feature

Allowable protrusion

Illustration

Television and radio antennas

up to 15' above maximum building
height

Chimneys and flues < 5' wide

may extend beyond the daylight plane to
meet minimum required clearance of
Building Code (Chapter 16.04)

Fig 20 on p. 26

Dormers, roof decks, gabels, or similar
architectural features

each feature ≤ 7.5' long and cumulative
length of all features ≤ 15' with min 5'
separation between features (on each
side); height ≤ 24';

Fig 20 on p. 26 &
Fig 23 on p. 28

Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural
features (excluding flat or continuous walls
or enclosures usable for interior space)

max 2'

Fig 22 on p. 27

29

visual_elements.description: A table summarizing allowable daylight plane protrusions. It has three columns: 'Feature', 'Allowable protrusion', and 'Illustration'. The table lists different architectural features and their corresponding protrusion limits and references to illustrative figures.

technical_specifications.parameter: Dormers, roof decks, gabels, or similar architectural features length per feature
Dormers, roof decks, gabels, or similar architectural features cumulative length
Dormers, roof decks, gabels, or similar architectural features minimum separation
Dormers, roof decks, gabels, or similar architectural features height
Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features protrusion

additional_notes: Page number '29' is present in the bottom right corner.
